VHSL power ratings Under the VHSL’s latest re-alignment, Hampton Roads teams are now spread across four classifications. For football, 16 teams from each region make postseason. The top eight eastern-most teams and the top eight western-most teams will be bracketed together. The winner from each of those brackets will play in a state semifinal.

Boys volleyball
#3 Bayside d. #1 Ocean Lakes, 3-1
(25-18, 20-25, 25-22, 25-18)
Luke Martin had 17 kills. Sean Davidson had 6 aces and 43 assists. Trinity Gadsden had 11 kills. Mike King had 9 blocks.
#2 Cox d. Landstown, 3-0
(25-19, 25-12, 25-23)
Brad Creamer had 14 kills and Grant Gilden added 22 assists to lead the Falcons.
#4 Maury d. Hickory, 3-0
(25-13, 26-24, 25-16)
Shane Limbaugh and Ashlar Peronnet had 7 kills apiece. Charlie Seerden had 31 assists.
#5 Princess Anne d. Norview, 3-0
(25-9, 25-17, 25-18)
Chase Howard had 17 kills. Courtland Scharenborg had 44 assists.
#6 Indian River d. Kempsville, 3-0
(25-13, 25-12, 25-11)
#8 Great Bridge d. Churchland, 3-0
(25-12, 25-14, 25-20)
Perry Dunkum had 14 kills. Christian Kangas 7 aces. Jackson Parker and Jason Jones had 14 assists each.

(25-18, 25-21, 25-20)
Noah Joyce had 12 kills and Dajour Rucker added 8 kills.

(25-19, 25-12, 25-15)

(25-22, 25-20, 19-25, 25-20)

(25-19, 25-21, 26-24)
Gracie Johnson had 9 kills and Camryn Stewart added 7 kills.

(25-9, 25-9, 25-14)

(25-18, 27-25, 25-12)
